result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

State of Wisconsin appears by ADA Andrew Burgoyne. DE appears in custody with Atty Xavier Solis.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  348 - Parties have rec'd and reviewed competency report. All parties stipulate to report's findings. Court finds DE is competent to proceed. All matters set for JT. For reasons set forth on the record, Court denies motion.  Jury status hearing scheduled for June 15, 2017 at 01:00 pm.  Jury selection scheduled for June 19, 2017 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 20, 2017 at 09:00 am.

State of Wisconsin appears by ADA Andrew Burgoyne. DE appears in person with Atty Xavier Solis.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  330 - Atty Solis raises the issue of competency. DE states he has been seeing Dr. Roehrich, though Dr. Roehrich is reportedly not available to appear as ordered at the last hearing. Court revokes bond. DE taken into custody pending outcome of competency eval.  Competency hearing scheduled for May 8, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

State of Wisconsin appears by Deputy District Attorney Angelina Gabriele. DE appears in person with Atty Xavier Solis.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  148 - Matter is resolved, though DE again claims he is not thinking clearly due to a medical issue. DE's doctor is ordered to appear at the next hearing by phone. ST makes record re: status of offer made to DE.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 13, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Acknowledgment of Plea Offer

State of Wisconsin appears by Deputy District Attorney Angelina Gabriele. DE appears in person with Atty Xavier Solis.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  954 - Matter is resolved. DE requests afternoon date for sentencing - granted.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 3, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
NO RECORD MADE. Negotiations continue with global resolution likely. Matter to remain on calendar to trail JS, JT. Atty Solis to report intentions re: JT on older cases to court by noon on 2/24/17.

MINUTES:  941 -   Victim rights compliance.  New offer made by ST. Atty Solis requests adjournment to review - denied. Trials on older cases will remain on the calendar as scheduled. If matters resolve, parties may contact court for a sooner date. Otherwise, cases will continue as set.

MINUTES:  308 -   Victim rights compliance.  Adjournment requested by Atty Solis - resolution imminent. Granted.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 30, 2017 at 09:30 am.
